Name: Electrolyte Solutions: Second Revised Edition (Dover Books on Chemistry)

ReviewList.Text: A very good introductionary book for students or engineers. Considers main classical conspects of ion transport, thermodynamics and conductivity. I've found a number of concepts in the contemporary papers and books that would be derived from the basics, described by the book. It would also be helpful for scientists/engineers who are not in the chemistry physics or chemistry. Requires basics of calculus. And yeah, much much less than $$$ XXXX pages useless "all-included" type of handbooks). The only disadvantage is that the bibliography can be extended according to the modern needs.
